intro: Chondrilla japonica, commonly known as Japanese sandmat, is a perennial flowering plant native to East Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in dry, sandy soils and is often found in coastal areas or disturbed habitats. Due to its hardy nature, it is sometimes considered a weed in agricultural settings.
